page.title: 13COUNTRY SPORTS,ROXWELL
page.content: { NEWLAND HALL}is a farm mostly used for country sports but the farm grows crops as well. The owner has dug lakes for fishing he has made a track for {HORSES}and also he has made a{CLAY {PIGEON SHOOT.}The family has owned the farm for 47 years but they only grew crops. The lakes have{CARP}in one and {TROUT}in the other. The TROUT lake holds 7\ million gallons of water and the CARP lake holds 2\ million gallons of water. The TROUT lake is 3\ acres in size and it took him 3 years to build. They dug 20 thousand tons of mud out of the TROUT lake. He employs four people, one of them is the bailiff another is a full time farm worker. The last two are to do with the clay pigeon shooting; one's an instructor and the other one's the ground manager.
